intro: Prieurella prieurii, commonly known as the golden star, is a rare and striking member of the Acanthaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers, which are clustered in showy inflorescences resembling stars. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is highly sought after by botanists and horticulturists.
